static convert_xlsx_2csv(input_path: str, save_path: str, sheet_name='Sheet1')[source]

Description

This method convert xlsx format file into csv. It allows to read data frame much quicker in the future in the code

param input_path:

xlsx buffer file

type input_path:

str

param save_path:

csv file location file

type save_path:

str

param sheet_name:

tab from xlsx file that is going to be saved as csv, by default “Sheet1”

type sheet_name:

str, optional

static csv2DataFrame(file_name: str, header: str = 'infer', use_cols=None, index_col=None, d_type=None, sep=',', names=None) → DataFrame[source]

This method reads comma separate file into a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • file_name (str) – a valid string path

  • header (str, optional) – row to use a column names by default ‘infer’. If none then data are read without columns.

  • use_cols (_type_, optional) – _description_, by default None

  • index_col (_type_, optional) – _description_, by default None

  • d_type (_type_, optional) – _description_, by default None

  • sep (str, optional) – _description_, by default “,”

  • names (_type_, optional) – _description_, by default None

Returns:

two dimensional data structure with labeled columns and indexes.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

static save_content_2txt(location: str, arr: Iterable)[source]

Description

This method allows the user to save content of the list into txt file.

param location:

Entire path for which we content from container want to drop.

type location:

str

param arr:

Container with elements to be paste into file.

type arr:

Iterable

Example

>>> IOTools.save_content_2txt(location=r"/Users/krzysiekbienias/Documents/GitHub/EquityAssetClass/drop_point",
>>>                            arr=["GC","Citi","UBS"])

static string_2qlDate(date: str) → QL[source]

Description

function converts string date representation and convert to equivalent quantlib object. Date must be in form Y-m-d. :param date: date time object that gonna be converted. Must be passed as year, month, day :type date: str

returns:

date as a QuantLib object

rtype:

QL
